location.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国北京市东城区
location.en: Dongcheng District, Beijing, People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 坐落在中华人民共和国北京市中心，紫禁城的南端，是明清两代北京皇城的正门，现为中华人民共和国的象征之一。
description.en: Located in the center of Beijing, People's Republic of China, at the southern end of the Forbidden City, it was the main gate of the Imperial City of Beijing during the Ming and Qing dynasties and is now a symbol of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 明代建筑匠师，天安门（时称承天门）的设计者。
description.en: A master craftsman of the Ming Dynasty, designer of Tiananmen (then known as Chengtianmen).

description.zh-cn: 明朝第三位皇帝，年号永乐。在他统治期间始建天安门。
description.en: The third emperor of the Ming Dynasty, with the era name Yongle. Tiananmen was first built during his reign.

description.zh-cn: 1457年，承天门（天安门前身）的木结构牌楼被雷电引发的火灾所摧毁。
description.en: In 1457, the wooden archway of Chengtianmen (the predecessor of Tiananmen) was destroyed by a fire caused by lightning.

description.zh-cn: 明朝第八位皇帝，年号成化。在他统治期间重建了被烧毁的承天门。
description.en: The eighth emperor of the Ming Dynasty, with the era name Chenghua. During his reign, the burnt-down Chengtianmen was rebuilt.

description.zh-cn: 明末民变领袖，1644年攻入北京后，在撤退前焚毁了包括承天门在内的建筑。
description.en: Leader of a peasant rebellion in the late Ming Dynasty. After capturing Beijing in 1644, he burned down buildings including Chengtianmen before retreating.

description.zh-cn: 清朝入关后的第一位皇帝，年号顺治。在他统治期间，承天门被重修并更名为天安门。
description.en: The first emperor of the Qing Dynasty after entering the Central Plains, with the era name Shunzhi. During his reign, Chengtianmen was rebuilt and renamed Tiananmen.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国国务院

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国务院
en: State Council of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的最高国家行政机关。
description.en: The highest state administrative organ of the People's Republic of China.

nodes.id: 全国重点文物保护单位

zh-cn: 全国重点文物保护单位
en: Major Historical and Cultural Site Protected at the National Level

description.zh-cn: 由中国国务院公布的、受国家保护的最高级别的不可移动文物。
description.en: The highest level of immovable cultural relics under state protection, announced by the State Council of China.

description.zh-cn: 1966年发生于中国河北省邢台地区的大地震，对天安门城楼的建筑结构造成了影响。
description.en: A major earthquake that occurred in the Xingtai area of Hebei Province, China, in 1966, which affected the structural integrity of the Tiananmen gate tower.

zh-cn: 北京中轴线——中国理想都城秩序的杰作

description.zh-cn: 指北京自元大都以来沿袭至今的城市中轴线，被列入世界遗产名录。
description.en: Refers to the urban axis of Beijing that has been followed since the Yuan Dynasty's Dadu, and is listed as a World Heritage Site.

description.zh-cn: 指被联合国教科文组织和世界遗产委员会确认的人类罕见的、目前无法替代的财富，是全人类公认的具有突出意义和普遍价值的文物古迹及自然景观。
description.en: Refers to rare and irreplaceable treasures of humanity, recognized by UNESCO and the World Heritage Committee, which are universally acknowledged to have outstanding significance and universal value as cultural relics, historical sites, and natural landscapes.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国中央人民政府成立典礼

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国中央人民政府成立典礼
en: The Proclamation of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 1949年10月1日，中华人民共和国中央人民政府在北京天安门广场举行的成立典礼。
description.en: On October 1, 1949, the Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China held its founding ceremony in Tiananmen Square, Beijing.

en: National Emblem of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的主权象征和标志，其中心图案为天安门。
description.en: The symbol and emblem of sovereignty of the People's Republic of China, with Tiananmen as its central design.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党、中华人民共和国、中国人民解放军的主要缔造者和领导人。自1949年起，其肖像一直悬挂于天安门城楼。
description.en: The main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China, the People's Republic of China, and the People's Liberation Army. His portrait has been displayed on the Tiananmen gate tower since 1949.

description.zh-cn: 苏联政治家，曾任苏联共产党中央委员会总书记、苏联部长会议主席。1953年去世时，天安门曾短暂悬挂其肖像以示哀悼。
description.en: Soviet politician who served as General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union and Chairman of the Council of Ministers. Upon his death in 1953, his portrait was briefly displayed on Tiananmen in mourning.

description.zh-cn: 北京市的行政管理机关。
description.en: The administrative organ of Beijing Municipality.

nodes.id: 天安门毛泽东像污损案

zh-cn: 天安门毛泽东像污损案

description.zh-cn: 1989年5月23日，三名青年向天安门城楼上的毛泽东肖像投掷颜料的事件。
description.en: On May 23, 1989, three young men threw paint-filled eggshells at the portrait of Mao Zedong on the Tiananmen gate tower.

description.zh-cn: 1989年天安门毛泽东像污损案的参与者之一。
description.en: One of the participants in the 1989 defacement of Mao Zedong's portrait at Tiananmen.

description.zh-cn: 1989年天安门毛泽东像污损案的参与者之一。
description.en: One of the participants in the 1989 defacement of Mao Zedong's portrait at Tiananmen.

description.zh-cn: 1989年天安门毛泽东像污损案的参与者之一。
description.en: One of the participants in the 1989 defacement of Mao Zedong's portrait at Tiananmen.

description.zh-cn: 2007年向天安门毛泽东肖像投掷燃烧物的男子。
description.en: A man who threw a burning object at the portrait of Mao Zedong on Tiananmen in 2007.

description.zh-cn: 2014年向天安门毛泽东肖像投掷墨水瓶的男子。
description.en: A man who threw an ink bottle at the portrait of Mao Zedong on Tiananmen in 2014.

nodes.id: 天安门金水桥恐怖袭击案

zh-cn: 天安门金水桥恐怖袭击案

description.zh-cn: 2013年10月28日，恐怖分子驾车冲撞天安门金水桥护栏后起火的事件。
description.en: On October 28, 2013, terrorists drove a car into the guardrail of the Jinshui Bridge at Tiananmen, causing it to catch fire.

description.zh-cn: 清朝末代皇帝溥仪的嫡母，在天安门颁布了《宣统帝退位诏书》。
description.en: The legal mother of Puyi, the last emperor of the Qing Dynasty, who promulgated the 'Imperial Edict of the Abdication of the Xuantong Emperor' at Tiananmen.

en: Imperial Edict of the Abdication of the Xuantong Emperor

description.zh-cn: 1912年2月12日由隆裕太后颁布，标志着清朝统治结束的法律文件。
description.en: A legal document promulgated by Empress Dowager Longyu on February 12, 1912, marking the end of the Qing Dynasty's rule.

description.zh-cn: 清朝末代皇帝，也是中国历史上最后一位皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Qing Dynasty and the last emperor in Chinese history.

description.zh-cn: 1919年5月4日发生于北京的一场以青年学生为主，广大群众、市民、工商人士等阶层共同参与的，通过示威游行、请愿、罢工、暴力对抗政府等多种形式进行的爱国运动。
description.en: A patriotic movement that took place in Beijing on May 4, 1919, primarily led by young students and involving the general public, citizens, and businesspeople, through various forms such as demonstrations, petitions, strikes, and violent confrontations with the government.

description.zh-cn: 位于北京市中心的城市广场，是多个中国重大历史事件的发生地。
description.en: A city square in the center of Beijing, which has been the site of many major historical events in China.

description.zh-cn: 1966年至1976年间在中华人民共和国发生的一场重大政治运动。
description.en: A major political movement that took place in the People's Republic of China from 1966 to 1976.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命时期中国大陆的青年学生组成的群众性组织。
description.en: Mass organizations composed of young students in mainland China during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 1989年发生在中国北京天安门广场的学生示威运动，后遭武力清场。
description.en: Student-led demonstrations in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, in 1989, which ended with a military crackdown.

description.zh-cn: 2001年1月23日在北京天安门广场发生的自焚事件。
description.en: A self-immolation incident that occurred on January 23, 2001, in Tiananmen Square, Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 明清时期北京的内城与紫禁城之间的区域，是服务于皇室的办公、居住、园林和仓储区。
description.en: The area between the Inner City and the Forbidden City in Beijing during the Ming and Qing dynasties, serving as an administrative, residential, garden, and storage area for the imperial family.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间北京市的权力机构，对1969年至1970年天安门的秘密重建工程起到了主导作用。
description.en: The organ of power in Beijing during the Cultural Revolution, which led the secret reconstruction of Tiananmen from 1969 to 1970.

description.zh-cn: 天安门是明清两代北京皇城的正门。
description.en: Tiananmen was the main gate of the Imperial City of Beijing during the Ming and Qing dynasties.

description.zh-cn: 蒯祥是天安门（时称承天门）的设计者。
description.en: Kuai Xiang was the designer of Tiananmen (then known as Chengtianmen).

description.zh-cn: 在明成祖（永乐年间）统治时期，天安门（时称承天门）始建。
description.en: During the reign of the Yongle Emperor (Ming Chengzu), Tiananmen (then known as Chengtianmen) was first built.

description.zh-cn: 1457年（天顺元年），天安门（时称承天门）的牌楼毁于雷火。
description.en: In 1457 (the first year of the Tianshun era), the archway of Tiananmen (then known as Chengtianmen) was destroyed by a lightning fire.

description.zh-cn: 在明宪宗（成化年间）统治时期，被烧毁的承天门被重建为城楼。
description.en: During the reign of the Chenghua Emperor (Ming Xianzong), the burnt-down Chengtianmen was rebuilt into a gate tower.

description.zh-cn: 1644年，李自成在撤离北京前焚毁了包括承天门在内的建筑。
description.en: In 1644, before retreating from Beijing, Li Zicheng burned down buildings including Chengtianmen.

description.zh-cn: 1651年（顺治八年），清世祖下令在废墟上大规模改建承天门，并重修为一座城楼。
description.en: In 1651 (the eighth year of the Shunzhi era), the Shunzhi Emperor ordered a large-scale reconstruction of Chengtianmen on its ruins, rebuilding it as a gate tower.

description.zh-cn: 1651年，承天门被清世祖更名为“天安门”。
description.en: In 1651, Chengtianmen was renamed 'Tiananmen' by the Shunzhi Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 由于结构问题和地震影响，北京市革命委员会主导了1969年至1970年对天安门的秘密拆除重建工程。
description.en: Due to structural issues and earthquake damage, the Beijing Municipal Revolutionary Committee led the secret demolition and reconstruction of Tiananmen from 1969 to 1970.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国国务院

description.zh-cn: 1961年3月4日，中华人民共和国国务院将天安门列入第一批全国重点文物保护单位。
description.en: On March 4, 1961, the State Council of the People's Republic of China listed Tiananmen as one of the first Major Historical and Cultural Sites Protected at the National Level.

relationships.target: 全国重点文物保护单位

description.zh-cn: 天安门是第一批全国重点文物保护单位之一。
description.en: Tiananmen is one of the first Major Historical and Cultural Sites Protected at the National Level.

description.zh-cn: 1966年的邢台大地震对天安门的建筑结构造成了损害，是其1970年重建的原因之一。
description.en: The 1966 Xingtai earthquake caused damage to the structure of Tiananmen, which was one of the reasons for its reconstruction in 1970.

description.zh-cn: 天安门是“北京中轴线”世界遗产项目的组成部分。
description.en: Tiananmen is a component of the 'Beijing Central Axis' World Heritage site.

description.zh-cn: “北京中轴线——中国理想都城秩序的杰作”项目于2024年7月27日入选《世界遗产名录》。
description.en: 'Beijing Central Axis: A Masterpiece of China's Ideal Capital City Order' was inscribed on the World Heritage List on July 27, 2024.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国中央人民政府成立典礼

description.zh-cn: 天安门是中华人民共和国开国大典的举办地，典礼在天安门城楼和天安门广场举行。
description.en: Tiananmen was the venue for the founding ceremony of the People's Republic of China, which was held on the Tiananmen gate tower and in Tiananmen Square.

description.zh-cn: 天安门的图案被设计在中华人民共和国国徽的正中。
description.en: The image of Tiananmen is designed in the center of the National Emblem of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 为悼念苏联领导人斯大林逝世，北京市政府于1953年3月9日将天安门城楼上的毛泽东肖像更换为斯大林肖像一天。
description.en: To mourn the death of Soviet leader Joseph Stalin, the Beijing Municipal Government replaced the portrait of Mao Zedong on the Tiananmen gate tower with a portrait of Stalin for one day on March 9, 1953.

relationships.target: 天安门毛泽东像污损案

description.zh-cn: 余志坚是1989年向天安门毛泽东肖像泼洒颜料事件的三名参与者之一。
description.en: Yu Zhijian was one of the three participants who splattered paint on the portrait of Mao Zedong at Tiananmen in 1989.

relationships.target: 天安门毛泽东像污损案

description.zh-cn: 喻东岳是1989年向天安门毛泽东肖像泼洒颜料事件的三名参与者之一。
description.en: Yu Dongyue was one of the three participants who splattered paint on the portrait of Mao Zedong at Tiananmen in 1989.

relationships.target: 天安门毛泽东像污损案

description.zh-cn: 鲁德成是1989年向天安门毛泽东肖像泼洒颜料事件的三名参与者之一。
description.en: Lu Decheng was one of the three participants who splattered paint on the portrait of Mao Zedong at Tiananmen in 1989.

relationships.source: 天安门毛泽东像污损案

description.zh-cn: 该事件污损了悬挂在天安门城楼的毛泽东肖像，是对其公众形象的破坏。
description.en: This incident defaced the portrait of Mao Zedong hanging on the Tiananmen gate tower, damaging his public image.

description.zh-cn: 2007年5月12日，顾海欧以自制燃烧物投向毛泽东肖像，造成肖像框轻微灼损。
description.en: On May 12, 2007, Gu Hai'ou threw a self-made incendiary device at the portrait of Mao Zedong, causing minor burn damage to the portrait frame.

description.zh-cn: 2014年3月6日，孙兵向天安门城楼毛泽东像投掷墨水瓶，造成肖像污损。
description.en: On March 6, 2014, Sun Bing threw an ink bottle at the portrait of Mao Zedong on the Tiananmen gate tower, causing defacement.

relationships.source: 天安门金水桥恐怖袭击案

description.zh-cn: 恐怖分子驾驶车辆撞向天安门金水桥护栏，对天安门前的设施造成了破坏。
description.en: Terrorists drove a vehicle into the guardrail of the Jinshui Bridge at Tiananmen, causing damage to the facilities in front of Tiananmen.

description.zh-cn: 1912年2月12日，隆裕太后在天安门颁布了《宣统帝退位诏书》。
description.en: On February 12, 1912, Empress Dowager Longyu promulgated the 'Imperial Edict of the Abdication of the Xuantong Emperor' at Tiananmen.

description.zh-cn: 该诏书的颁布标志着宣统皇帝（溥仪）的统治正式结束。
description.en: The promulgation of this edict marked the official end of the reign of the Xuantong Emperor (Puyi).

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命期间，毛泽东在天安门城楼八次接见了来自全国各地的红卫兵。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Mao Zedong met with Red Guards from all over the country eight times on the Tiananmen gate tower.

description.zh-cn: 五四运动中的学生集会和示威游行主要在天安门广场区域进行。
description.en: The student assemblies and demonstrations of the May Fourth Movement primarily took place in the Tiananmen Square area.

description.zh-cn: 天安门广场是1989年学生运动和六四事件的中心地点。
description.en: Tiananmen Square was the central location for the 1989 student movement and the June Fourth Incident.

description.zh-cn: 2001年的天安门自焚事件发生在天安门广场上。
description.en: The 2001 Tiananmen self-immolation incident occurred on Tiananmen Square.
